body.name: Lehman's Manual Clothes Washer Plunger, Portable Breathing Washing Agitator for Bucket, Sink or Tub
features: Named "breathing" washer because of the sound it makes as its unique action effectively pushes and pulls soap and water through your clothes
Faster, more economical and much more efficient than traditional hand washing, and it just may get your clothes cleaner than an electric or gas-powered machine
Ideal for campers, RV users and college students washing small loads of laundry anytime, safely cleans delicate items
Also great for washing clothes during power outages - requires minimal water and less soap
Heavy-duty plastic agitator and splash guard, 3-piece aluminum collapsible handle with heavy duty metal threads and storage bag; 31.75" high
body.description: Discover Our Hand Clothes Washer Plunger. Take our breathing mobile washer anywhere and get your laundry done. Plunge up and down to force soap and water through clothes and linens - it's that simple. Faster, more economical and much more efficient than traditional hand washing, and it just may get your clothes cleaner than an electric or gas-powered machine. Reduces wear on clothes and saves water, too. No electricity needed (all you need is a little arm power). Collapsible design means you can take it with you easily - great for the campsite, RVs, apartments, power outages and more. 3-piece collapsible handle with heavy duty metal threads. Named "breathing" washer because of the sound it makes as its unique action effectively pushes and pulls soap and water through your clothes. Use in a bucket (5-gallon suggested), sink or tub. You can also rinse your clothes using fresh water.. Heavy-duty plastic agitator and splash guard. Drawstring storage bag included. When assembled 31-3/4"H. How It Works: Our hand-operated clothes washer uses a technique of pushing and pulling water through clothes opposed to top and front loading washing machines that only splashes water around or the harsh scrubbing of a washboard resulting in a superior clean with less wear and tear. Features of Breathing Hand Washer: 3-piece collapsible handle for convenient transport and storage. Just use the included drawstring storage bag to keep all the pieces in one place. T-handle for ergonomic use. Uses minimal water and less soap. Aluminum will last for years. Ideal for campers, RV users and college students washing small loads of laundry anytime, safely cleans delicate items. Also great for washing clothes during power outages. Environmentally conscious.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars You'll never beat the quality of Lehmans
reviews.reviewText: Love this brand. This is a great alternative to an electric washer when you live further from civilization.The quality is out of this world. Don't buy those cheap plastic ones, they won't last. This is a multi piece metal/plastic design that is sure to clean my clothing right.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Use this off the grid and I swear it gets my clothes cleaner than my on grid washing machine. Plus I get my exercise while washing clothes. Maybe we should all go back to doing laundry this way. I have 3 buckets I use in succession and then air dry, clothes smell like fresh air and are clean! Just remember to use minimal soap and biodegradable earth friendly soap so you can dump your buckets without guilt! Dr Bronners works great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Positives:*The stick is very tall. Maybe 4 feet tall at least? So you can easily stand up and use it.*It feels super durable. I don't think any of the parts could break. The metal is very thick. The plastic is very thick too.I haven't used it yet, but I don't think it will need much arm force to use it because it is not heavy.Negatives:I had a difficult time assembling the metal pieces. The edge of the metal is thick and a bit sharp and you have to push very hard down on the metal buttons to get them to slide through the holes. I was so worried I might slice my skin off. The buttons just required too much force to push them down. Maybe I did it wrong, but I don't see myself taking this apart in between laundry washes, which means it will take up a lot of space as the thing is kinda big. It probably took me 30 mins to get all the metal pieces together and I had to push onto the floor really hard with all of my weight like throwing myself onto it to get it to snap together. If it wasn't for this, it would be perfect.But I think the value is good for the money because I almost bought the all-plastic version of this (which I imagine is easy to put together/take apart) however, a lot of reviews for that one had it breaking in half, which would be a waste of money. and this thing, despite it nearly being impossible to put together/take apart, seems it'll last forever, so long as you're ok with having it take up some space--or maybe you are extremely strong with big Shrek type hands and the metal buttons would be easier for you to push through?Update: It works well. It does plunge the water through. I found you CAN twist off the top handle and the bottom plastic pieces EASILY which reduces its height a lot. I take it apart doing this and leave the metal stick assembled. This way it takes up WAY much less space without struggling with putting the metal pieces together.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Works like a charm!! Agitates exactly how I was hoping it would. A perfect backup when needed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy, well designed, but read before assembly
reviews.reviewText: Loved the quality overall and ease of disassembly and ready storage pouch. However, the cast metal threads on either end of the rod that enters the handle and the cone shaped plunger were not cleared of the sharp casting seams and flashing from the molding process and can destroy the softer plastic threads inside the handle and plunger upon assembly. Inspect them and file the excess sharp thin metal from between the threads before assembly. I didn't see the problem until upon feeling resistance to turning, I unscrewed the handle from the plunger and found that the sharp metal extending into the trough of the metal threads had damaged the plastic ones inside the threaded plunger tube and gouged a considerable amount of the softer material away. This is a deficit in finishing and easily corrected before assembly. The item is much higher quality than I expected in every other respect.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024

reviews.reviewText: Je ne suis pas manuel mais1. J’ai enlevé facilement les copeaux de la soudure avec des outils utilisés par un réparateur de montres MESEE.2. Une femme très manuelle a réussi rapidement à assembler les 3 morceaux en aluminium formant le bâton.3. J’utilise le savon SOAK liquide.4. Si j’utilise un nouveau vêtement délicat, je le passe à l’eau pour vérifier si sa couleur déteint.Ce procédé de lavage à la main est tout simplement révolutionnaire et efficace.Je le recommande vivement.
